title: Imam Ali al-Naqi and Imam al-Hasan al-Askari (as)
text: DESC: When you are at the gate of the holy shrine, you may ask permission of entrance and recite the following form of ziyarah, which is considered the most authentic
INFO: At the gate of the holy shrine
alssalamu `alaykuma ya nuray allahi fi zulumati al-ardi
alssalamu `alaykuma ya man bada lillahi fi sha'nikuma
wa an yarzuqani murafaqatakuma fi aljinani
wa as'aluhu an yu`tiqa raqabati min alnnari
wa an la yaj`alahu akhira al`ahdi min ziyaratikuma
wa yahshurani ma`akuma fi aljannati birahmatihi
allahumma il`an zalimi ali muhammadin haqqahum wantaqim minhum
DESC: You may then pray for yourself and your parents.
DESC: If you can reach their tombs, you may offer a two-unit prayer there. or in the mosque which is adjacent to the house of the two Imams (as), where they used to perform the prayers.
INFO: Ziyarah with a Little Difference

DESC: The aforesaid form of ziyarah has been cited according to the book of Kamil al-Ziyarah. However, Shaykh Muhammad ibn al-Mashhadi, Shaykh al-Mufid, and al-Shahid, in their books on forms of ziyarah, have recorded it with little difference. i.e. added the following:
INFO: You may then approach towards the two tombs, throw yourself on them, kiss them, and place your two cheeks on them. When you raise your head, you may say the following
DESC: They then added: You may now offer four units of prayer next to the side of the Imamâ€™s head.
